description: Hygiene education in the United States focused primarily on cleanliness, immorality, and sexually transmitted diseases.
Ella Flagg Young, the superintendent of Chicago Public Schools was the first to attempt implementing a city-wide sex-hygiene program in secondary schools
Fight against venereal disease as matter of national security
US engaged in World War 1
The U.S. Department of Labor’s Children’s Bureau releases a report suggesting sex education during school could have better protected soldiers from STIs.
(white) Women gain right to vote
Human sexuality courses start to appear in colleges
The Great Depression and then US joins WW2
Kinsey Report challenges norms (establishes sex research as a field and sparks debate by showing how many people do taboo things)
Homophile movement growing
Cold war
lavender scare
Sexuality Information and Education Council of the US (SIECUS) is founded.
Civil Rights Act (Title VII prohibits employment discrimination based on sex)
Griswold v. Connecticut legalizes birth control for married couples
Stonewall uprising
Our Bodies, Ourselves published
Title IX passed
row v wade
Homosexuality declassified as disorder
Anita Bryant’s anti-gay campaign Save Our Children campaign
The global pandemic of HIV/AIDS begins, it is an ongoing worldwide public health issue.
“Ego-dystonic homosexuality” removed from DSM
School-based sex ed curricula shift toward risk reduction (not abstinence-only, but not fully comprehensive either)
ACT UP protests
Every state has a mandate for AIDS education
Abstinence-only funding begins federally.
Defense of Marriage Act (DOMA)
U.S. Surgeon General calls for comprehensive sex ed
Lawrence v. Texas sodomy laws struck
First same-sex marriage in Massachusetts.
Asexual visibility rises — AVEN (Asexual Visibility & Education Network) gains traction, communities create 'Ace Week' and push for inclusion in queer spaces and sex ed
M.C. v. Aaronson: First U.S. lawsuit over non-consensual surgery on an intersex child (South Carolina). Case draws national attention to intersex rights.
Trans visibility rises nationally
Obergefell overturned Baker and requires states to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples and to recognize same-sex marriages.
altText: celebration with a couple kissing in front of white house

description: CA first state to mandate that LGBTQ+ content be included in sex ed
Obama-era Title IX guidance clarifies protections for trans students — includes access to bathrooms and pronouns in schools
Trump rescinds Title IX guidance protecting trans students — major rollback on federal recognition
U.N. and WHO release updated guidelines supporting comprehensive sexuality education, globally endorsed (not adopted by US)
COVID-19 pandemic
SCOTUS: Civil Rights Act covers LGBTQ+
Roe v Wade is overturned
Polarization over sex ed, race, and LGBTQ+ issues in schools intensifies including “Don’t Say Gay” laws
